roadway_dispersion
Class receptor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--roadway_dispersion.receptor
public class receptor
extends java.lang.Object

Overview
The receptor class represents a person or target coordinate near a roadway. This class stores the pollutant concentration contribution from each link. Note - All units in this file and the model are metric (MKS) unless otherwise stated. 

 ACTION AND REVISION LOG
 Author              Date    Action
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Tony Held(TH)     11-15-99  cpp file created
 TH                11-20-99  cpp class tested, debuged, and documented
 TH                08-16-00  receptor class ported to java

1.0 (October 2001)

Field Detail

naming

public default_naming naming
This member adds default naming capacity for the receptors. It allows a sequenced name to be assigned to each receptor if the user does not specify a name.

links

private java.util.Vector links
Each receptor object has a copy of the links that contribute concentration to the receptor.

link_names

private java.util.Vector link_names
Each link has a name assoicated with it. The vector order of the name coresponds to the links vector.

concentration

private double[] concentration
concentration is an array with each member representing a pollutant concentration (g/m^3) from each link. Note: remeber that array's index are zero based

location

private coordinate location
location is the coordinate representing the location of the receptor.

total_concentration

private double total_concentration
total_concentration of pollutants from all contributing links for this receptor.

Method Detail

clear_links

public void clear_links()
This routine removes all the links from the calling object's link vector.

calculate_concentration

public void calculate_concentration(boolean print_point_arrays_to_text_file)
This routine determines the contributing concentrations from all members in the link vector to this receptor.
Parameters:
print_point_arrays_to_text_file - determines if the point array for each link will be printed to a text file.

addLinkCopy

public void addLinkCopy(link link_to_add)
Each receptor has an internal vector that stores a copy of all the links That contribute pollutant concentrations to it. Use this method to add a copy of a link to the receptor vector. adding a link to a receptor will increment the concentration array and reinitialize all the links all the concentration contributions to each link = 0.0
Parameters:
link_to_add -  

addLinkCopy

public void addLinkCopy(java.util.Vector link_vector_to_add)
Each receptor has an internal vector that stores a copy of all the links That contribute pollutant concentrations to it. Use this method to add a copy of a vector of links to the receptor vector.
Parameters:
link_to_add -  

getLink

public link getLink(int index)
Routine to return a reference to a link in the link vector. The index indicates the possition of the desired link.

value of location.

setLocation

public void setLocation(coordinate v)
Set the value of location = copy of the coordinate argument.
Parameters:
v - Value to assign to location.

getTotal_concentration

public double getTotal_concentration()
getTotal_concentration method returns the pollutant concentration from all known links.
Returns:
a double value representing the pollutant concentration in g/m^3.

known_links

public int known_links()
known_links return number of known links to make sure concentration contributions indicies are valid.
Returns:
an int value representing the number of links to be modeled.

add_concentration

private void add_concentration(int link_num,
                               double x)
add_concentration adds a concentration contribution from a link to a receptor.
Parameters:
link_num - an int value representing the link that contributed a pollutant concentration.
x - a double value representing the concentration contriubted from link link_num.
